description: Enhance the /concepts page with dedicated sections explaining the three primary agents (Planner, Builder, Toolkit), including agent cards, workflow list, and quick reference table

userStories.title: Primary Agents Overview Section
userStories.description: As a visitor to the concepts page, I want to see a clear visual section explaining the three primary agents so that I understand the distinct roles before diving into details
acceptanceCriteria: Section appears between 'How It All Works Together' and 'Explore Each Concept'
Section title: 'Working with the Primary Agents'
Brief intro paragraph explaining these are your entry points to the system
Uses a three-column layout (responsive to single column on mobile)
Each agent card shows: icon, name, one-sentence purpose, and 3-4 bullet points of responsibilities
Visual distinction between agents using existing color scheme: Planner=violet, Builder=blue, Toolkit=amber
Each card links to relevant detail page
Works in both light and dark mode
userStories.e2eScope: Verify section renders with three agent cards in correct layout
userStories.testIntensityReason: Establishes section structure and responsive layout

userStories.title: Planner Agent Card
userStories.description: As a visitor to the concepts page, I want to understand what Planner does at a glance so that I know when to use it
acceptanceCriteria: Bullet points: Creates and refines PRDs with user stories, Asks clarifying questions to tighten scope, Defines acceptance criteria, Never writes code—planning only
'How you use it' snippet: @planner I want to add [feature]...
Works in both light and dark mode
userStories.e2eScope: Verify Planner card content and link works

userStories.title: Builder Agent Card
userStories.description: As a visitor to the concepts page, I want to understand what Builder does at a glance so that I know when to use it
acceptanceCriteria: One-liner: 'Execute PRDs and handle ad-hoc tasks'
Bullet points: Implements user stories from PRDs, Delegates to specialist sub-agents, Runs quality gates and commits code, Handles quick fixes without PRDs
'How you use it' snippet: @builder Implement the PRD or @builder Fix the login bug
Works in both light and dark mode
userStories.e2eScope: Verify Builder card content and link works

userStories.title: Toolkit Agent Card
userStories.description: As a visitor to the concepts page, I want to understand what Toolkit does at a glance so that I know when to use it
acceptanceCriteria: Bullet points: Processes pending updates from agents, Creates and modifies agents/skills/scaffolds, Maintains toolkit-wide consistency, Used less frequently than Planner/Builder
'How you use it' snippet: @toolkit Review pending updates
Works in both light and dark mode
userStories.e2eScope: Verify Toolkit card content and link works

userStories.title: Agent Workflow List
userStories.description: As a visitor to the concepts page, I want to understand how the agents work together so that I understand the coordination model
acceptanceCriteria: Appears below the three agent cards

Numbered list showing typical workflow: 1. Plan — Start with @planner to create a PRD, 2. Build — Hand the ready PRD to @builder, 3. Improve — Agents discover gaps and queue updates for @toolkit, 4. Repeat — Better agents lead to better planning and building
Brief note: 'This is the Agent Loop. Each phase has clear ownership between you and the agents.'
Link to /concepts/workflow (The Agent Loop page) for the full breakdown
Works in both light and dark mode
userStories.e2eScope: Verify workflow list renders and link to /concepts/workflow works

userStories.title: Quick Reference Table
userStories.description: As a visitor to the concepts page, I want to see a quick reference comparing when to use each agent so that I can quickly decide which agent to invoke
acceptanceCriteria: Table with columns: Scenario | Agent | Why

Rows: 'New multi-story feature' → Planner → 'Needs requirements before code', 'Quick bug fix' → Builder → 'Scope is clear, just implement', 'Implement a ready PRD' → Builder → 'Planning done, time to execute', 'Refine unclear requirements' → Planner → 'Need to explore before building', 'Improve an agent's behavior' → Toolkit → 'Meta-level toolkit change'
Styled consistently with existing tables on the site
Link to 'Human in the Loop' page for more decision guidance
Works in both light and dark mode
userStories.e2eScope: Verify table renders with correct content and styling
